intro: Linaria gharbensis f. mekinensis, commonly known as the Mekin's toadflax, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of North Africa. It belongs to the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun conditions. Its foliage consists of lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. This rare botanical variant is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
